ga: 11 Márta 2021 – Mhol an Coimisiún Eorpach €530 milliún a úsáid faoi Chiste Dlúthpháirtíochta an Aontais chun paindéim an choróinvíris a chomhrac
en: 11 March 2021 – The European Commission proposes to use €530 million under the EU Solidarity fund to fight the coronavirus pandemic

ga: Tá an Coimisiún ag cur chun tosaigh pacáiste tacaíochta airgeadais dar luach beagnach €530 milliún faoi Chiste Dlúthpháirtíochta an Aontais chun tacú leis an gcaiteachas poiblí ar threalamh cosanta leighis agus pearsanta, leis an tacaíocht éigeandála don phobal agus le bearta arb é is aidhm dóibh leathadh an ghalair a chosc agus rialú agus monatóireacht a dhéanamh air.
en: The European Commission is putting forward a package of almost €530 million in financial support under the EU Solidarity Fund to support public expenditure on medical and personal protective equipment, emergency support to the population, and measures to prevent, monitor and control of the spread of the disease.

ga: Cargo freight on palettes branded with EU flag being loaded onto an airplane.
en: Cargo freight on palettes branded with EU flag being loaded onto an airplane.

ga: 10 Márta 2021 – Gníomh nua maidir le seachadadh cabhrach domhanda an Aontais, atá faoi dhúshlán ag COVID-19
en: 10 March 2021 – New action for EU's global aid delivery challenged by COVID-19

ga: Chuir an Coimisiún i láthair Teachtaireacht maidir le gníomhaíocht dhaonnúil, ina leagtar amach conas is féidir leis an Aontas beart a dhéanamh agus freastal ar na dúshláin dhaonnúla arb é paindéim COVID-19 is cúis leo.
en: The Commission presented a Communication on humanitarian action, setting out how the EU can step up and meet humanitarian challenges brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic.

ga: 4 Márta 2021 – Téarnamh lena gcruthófar poist a chinntiú: Tacaíocht éifeachtach don fhostaíocht leagtha amach sa phlean gníomhaíochta um Cholún Eorpach na gCeart Sóisialta
en: 4 March 2021 – Ensuring a job-rich recovery: Action plan on the European of Social Rights sets out effective support to employment

ga: Mar chuid den Phlean Gníomhaíochta um Cholún Eorpach na gCeart Sóisialta, chuir an Coimisiún Eorpach moladh i láthair chuig na Ballstáit maidir leis an mbealach a réiteach don aistriú ón tacaíocht do phoist le linn géarchéime go dtí poist a chruthú a sheasfaidh an aimsir: Tacaíocht ghníomhach éifeachtach don fhostaíocht (EASE).
en: As part of the Action Plan on the European Pillar of Social Rights, the European Commission presented a Recommendation for Member States to ease the transition from crisis-job-support to creating future-proof jobs: Effective Active Support to Employment (EASE).

ga: 3 Márta 2021 – Aon bhliain amháin ó thosaigh COVID-19: nuashonrú ar fhreagairt an bheartais fhioscaigh
en: 3 March 2021 – One year since the outbreak of COVID-19: updated fiscal policy response

ga: Ghlac an Coimisiún Teachtaireacht lena dtugtar treoir leathan do na Ballstáit maidir le cur i gcrích an bheartais fhioscaigh sa tréimhse atá romhainn agus ina leagtar amach breithnithe an Choimisiúin i dtaca leis an gclásal éalaithe ginearálta a dhíghníomhachtú nó a choinneáil ag gníomhachtú.
en: The Commission has adopted a Communication providing Member States with broad guidance on the conduct of fiscal policy in the period ahead and setting out the Commission's considerations regarding the deactivation or continued activation of the general escape clause.

ga: President von der Leyen
en: President von der Leyen

ga: 24 Feabhra 2021 – Labhair an tUachtarán von der Leyen ag seoladh Fheachtas Global Citizen, ‘Plean Téarnaimh don Domhan’
en: 24 February 2021 - President von der Leyen spoke at the Global Citizen Campaign launch event ‘A Recovery Plan for the World'

ga: Ag seoladh Fheachtas Global Citizen, bhí an méid seo le rá ag an Uachtarán von der Leyen: ‘Faighimis an lámh in uachtar ar an bpaindéim le feachtas vacsaínithe domhanda.
en: At the launch even of the Global Citizen Campaign, President von der Leyen said: Let us overcome the pandemic with a global vaccination campaign.

ga: 19 Feabhra 2021 – Dúbailt déanta go €1 bhilliún ag an Aontas Eorpach ar a ranníocaíocht le COVAX chun vacsaíní sábháilte éifeachtacha a chinntiú
en: 19 February 2021 - EU doubles contribution to COVAX to €1 billion to ensure safe and effective vaccines

ga: D’fhógair an tAontas Eorpach €500 milliún breise do shaoráid COVAX, rud a d’fhág go raibh dúbailt déanta aige ar an méid atá ranníoctha aige go dtí seo le haghaidh an tionscnaimh dhomhanda chun rochtain chóir chomhionann a chur ar fáil ar vacsaíní sábháilte éifeachtacha in aghaidh COVID-19.
en: The European Union announced an additional €500 million for the COVAX Facility, doubling its contribution to date for the global initiative secure fair and equitable access to safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines.

ga: 17 Feabhra 2021 – Aghaidh á tabhairt ag an gCoimisiún Eorpach ar athraithigh COVID-19 agus an ullmhacht á méadú aige
en: 17 February 2021 – European Commission tackles COVID-19 variants while increasing preparedness

ga: Bunóidh an Coimisiún plean nua bithchosanta ar a dtabharfar Gorlann HERA chun dul i ngleic le bagairtí gearrthéarmacha agus meántéarmacha agus, ag an am céanna, chun ullmhú don todhchaí mar threoirphlean d’ullmhacht fhadtéarmach an Aontais maidir le héigeandálaí sláinte.
en: The Commission will establish a new bio-defence plan called HERA Incubator to tackle short to medium-term threats and simultaneously prepare for the future by serving as the blueprint for the EU’s long term preparedness for health emergencies.

ga: 11 Feabhra 2021 – Réamhaisnéis Eacnamaíoch Gheimhreadh 2021 foilsithe: geimhreadh dúshlánach, ach ábhar dóchais dúinn go léir
en: 11 February 2021 – Winter 2021 Economic Forecast published: a challenging winter, but light at the end of the tunnel

ga: D’fhoilsigh an Coimisiún Eorpach Réamhaisnéis Eacnamaíoch Gheimhreadh 2021 ina dtuartar go bhfásfaidh geilleagar an limistéir euro 3.
en: The European Commission has published its Winter 2021 Economic Forecast, which projects that the euro area economy will grow by 3.

ga: Image of the Berlaymont banner "Next Generation EU"
en: Image of the Berlaymont banner "Next Generation EU"

ga: 10 Feabhra 2021 – An tSaoráid Téarnaimh agus Athléimneachta dar luach €672.5 billiún formheasta ag Parlaimint na hEorpa chun cuidiú leis na Ballstáit a bheith níos láidre tar éis na géarchéime
en: 10 February 2021 – €672.5 billion Recovery and Resilience Facility to help member states emerge stronger from the crisis approved by the European Parliament

ga: Is díol sásaimh don Choimisiún Eorpach é vóta Pharlaimint na hEorpa lena ndeimhnítear an comhaontú polaitiúil ar ar tháinig sí maidir leis an tSaoráid Téarnaimh agus Athléimneachta i mí na Nollag 2020.
en: The European Commission welcomes the European Parliament's vote confirming the political agreement reached on the Recovery and Resilience Facility of December 2020.

ga: AstraZeneca
en: AstraZeneca

ga: An 29 Eanáir 2021 – an tríú vacsaín shábháilte éifeachtach in aghaidh COVID-19 údaraithe ag an gCoimisiún Eorpach
en: 29 January 2021 – European Commission authorises third safe and effective vaccine against COVID-19

ga: Thug an Coimisiún údarú margaíochta coinníollach don vacsaín in aghaidh COVID-19 a d’fhorbair AstraZeneca, rud a d’fhág gurb í an tríú vacsaín a údaraíodh san Aontas.
en: The Commission has granted a conditional marketing authorisation for the vaccine against COVID-19 developed by AstraZeneca, making it the third vaccine authorised in the EU.

ga: proof of COVID-19 vaccination
en: proof of COVID-19 vaccination

ga: 27 Eanáir 2021 – Treoirlínte glactha ag Ballstáit an Aontais maidir le cruthúnas ar vacsaíniú COVID-19 chun críocha leighis
en: 27 January 2021 – EU Member States adopt guidelines on proof of COVID-19 vaccination for medical purposes

ga: Ghlac Ballstáit an Aontais, le tacaíocht ón gCoimisiún Eorpach, treoirlínte maidir le cruthúnas ar vacsaíniú COVID-19 chun críocha leighis.
en: The EU Members States, with the support of the European Commission, adopted guidelines on proof of COVID-19 vaccination for medical purposes.

ga: People walking in an airport
en: People walking in an airport

ga: 25 Eanáir 2021 – Nuashonrú molta ag an gCoimisiún Eorpach ar an gcur chuige comhordaithe i leith na saorghluaiseachta laistigh den Aontas, agus i leith taisteal ó thríú tíortha isteach san Aontas
en: 25 January 2021 – The European Commission proposes to update the coordinated approach on free movement inside the EU, and travel from third countries to the EU

ga: Tá coimircí breise agus ceanglais bhreise á moladh ag an gCoimisiún le haghaidh taistealaithe idirnáisiúnta isteach san Aontas, chomh maith le nuashonrú ar an Moladh ón gComhairle maidir le bearta comhordaithe a imríonn tionchar ar an tsaorghluaiseacht laistigh den Aontas.
en: The Commission is proposing additional safeguards and requirements for international travellers into the EU, and to update the Council Recommendation on coordinated measures affecting free movement within the EU.

ga: vaccines
en: vaccines

ga: 21 Eanáir 2021 – D’aontaigh ceannairí an Aontais dlús a chur le vacsaíniú agus pléadh bearta eile i gcruinniú de chuid na Comhairle Eorpaí
en: 21 January 2021 - EU leaders agreed on speeding up vaccination and discussed other measures at European Council

ga: Ag cruinniú de chuid na Comhairle Eorpaí, thug na ceannairí dá n-aire a thromchúisí atá an staid, go háirithe i bhfianaise athraitheacha nua an choróinvíris.
en: At the European Council meeting, leaders noted the seriousness of the situation in the light of the new variants.

ga: person being vaccinated
en: person being vaccinated

ga: 19 Eanáir 2021 – Na príomhghníomhaíochtaí leagtha amach ag an gCoimisiún i dtaobh seasamh le chéile chun COVID-19 a chloí
en: 19 January 2021 – The European Commission sets out key actions for a united front to beat COVID-19

ga: Dhá lá roimh fhíschomhdháil na gCeannairí Eorpacha maidir le freagairt chomhordaithe ar an gcoróinvíreas, d’fhoilsigh an Coimisiún Teachtaireacht inar leagadh amach na gníomhaíochtaí is gá a dhéanamh chun dlús a chur leis an gcomhrac in aghaidh na paindéime agus leis an vacsaíniú.
en: Two days ahead of European Leaders’ videoconference on a coordinate response to the coronavirus, the Commission set out actions in a Communication to step up the fight against the pandemic and speed up vaccination.

ga: girl getting vaccinated
en: girl getting vaccinated

ga: 12 Eanáir 2021 – Cainteanna tosaigh tugtha chun críche ag an gCoimisiún Eorpach le Valneva maidir le vacsaín fhéideartha nua in aghaidh an choróinvíris a fháil
en: 12 January 2021 – The European Commission concludes exploratory talks with Valneva to secure a new potential vaccine

ga: Tá cainteanna tosaigh tugtha chun críche ag an gCoimisiún Eorpach leis an gcomhlacht cógaisíochta Valneva d’fhonn a vacsaín fhéideartha in aghaidh COVID-19 a cheannach nuair a bheith sé cruthaithe go bhfuil sí sábháilte éifeachtach.
en: The Commission has concluded exploratory talks with the pharmaceutical company Valneva with a view to purchasing its potential vaccine against COVID-19 once proven safe and effective.

ga: pfizer vaccine
en: pfizer vaccine

ga: 8 Eanáir 2021 – mhol an Coimisiún Eorpach suas le 300 milliún dáileog bhreise a cheannach de vacsaín BioNTech-Pfizer
en: 8 January 2021 - European Commission proposes to purchase up to 300 million additional doses of BioNTech-Pfizer vaccine

ga: Mhol an Coimisiún do na Ballstáit 200 milliún dáileog bhreise a cheannach den vacsaín in aghaidh COVID-19 de chuid BioNTech agus Pfizer, leis an rogha ann 100 milliún dáileog eile a fháil.
en: The Commission proposed to EU Member States to purchase an additional 200 million doses of the BioNTech and Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine, with the option of acquiring another 100 million doses.

ga: vaccination medical student
en: vaccination medical student

ga: 6 Eanáir 2021 – an dara vacsaín shábháilte éifeachtach in aghaidh COVID-19 údaraithe ag an gCoimisiún Eorpach
en: 6 January 2021 - European Commission authorises second safe and effective vaccine against COVID-19

ga: Thug an Coimisiún údarú margaíochta coinníollach don vacsaín in aghaidh COVID-19 a d’fhorbair Moderna, rud a d’fhág gurb í an dara vacsaín a údaraíodh san Aontas.
en: The Commission has granted a conditional marketing authorisation for the vaccine against COVID-19 developed by Moderna, the second vaccine authorised in the EU.

ga: Cosnaíonn vacsaíniú daoine ar ghalair thógálacha thromchúiseacha agus iad siúd atá bagrach don bheatha, amhail an fliú, diftéire, teiteanas, triuch, an bhruitíneach, leicneach, rubella (bruitíneach dhearg), galar meiningeacocúil, galar niúmacocúil ionrach agus póilió.
en: Vaccination protects people against serious and life-threatening infectious diseases, such as influenza (flu), diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis (whooping cough), measles, mumps, rubella (German measles), meningococcal disease, invasive pneumococcal disease and polio.

ga: Gach bliain cuireann vacsaíniú cosc ar 2.
en: Each year, vaccination stops 2.

ga: San am atá caite, fuair a lán daoine bás le galair, galair ar féidir leo a chosc sa lá inniu le vacsaíniú.
en: In the past, many people died of diseases that can now be prevented through vaccination.

ga: An Bhruitíneach
en: Measles

ga: 12-18 nduine
en: 12-18 people

ga: Is ionann an ponc sa lár agus duine amháin atá ionfhabhtaithe ag galar.
en: The centre dot represent one person affected by a disease.

ga: Cuidíonn vacsaíniú scaipeadh na ngalar i bpobail a chosc.
en: Vaccination helps prevent the spread of disease in communities.

ga: Agus a bhuí le vacsaíniú:
en: Thanks to vaccination:

ga: Tábolgach díothaithe ar fud an domhain;
en: smallpox is now eradicated worldwide;

ga: Cuireadh deireadh le trais-seoladh póilió i mórchuid den domhan, an Eoraip san áireamh.
en: transmission of polio has ended in most parts of the world, including Europe.

ga: Cuireann vacsaíniú cosc ar fhorbairt cineálacha éagsúla meallta réamhailseacha agus ailsí, mar shampla:
en: Vaccination also prevents the development of certain types of pre-cancerous growths and cancers, for example:

ga: Féadann vacsaíniú in aghaidh papalómaivíreas daonna (HPV) cuidiú le hailse agus ailsí eile is cúis le hionfhabhtú HPV a chosc;
en: vaccinating against humanpapilloma virus (HPV) can help prevent cervical and other cancers caused by HPV infection;

ga: Féadann vacsaíniú in aghaidh Heipitíteas B cuidiú le hailse ae, rud is cúis le hionfhabhtú de Heipitíteas B fadtéarmach.
en: vaccinating against hepatitis B can help prevent liver cancer caused by long-term hepatitis B infection.

ga: Tá buntáistí sochaíocha níos forleithnei gcláir vacsaínithe.
en: Vaccination programmes have wider societal benefits.

ga: Is é vacsaíniú an bealach is fearr le himdhíonacht a fháil in aghaidh galair inchoiscthe trí vacsaíniú, seachas imdhíonacht a bhaint amach tríd an ngalar a fháil.
en: Vaccination is the best way to acquire immunity against vaccine-preventable diseases, as opposed to immunity attained by getting the disease.

ga: Tugann vacsaíniú cosaint do na daoine vacsaínithe agus dóibh siúd atá timpeall orthu atá i mbaol na ngalar, rud a laghdaíonn an baol go scaipfidh galair i measc daoine de theaghlach, cairde scoile nó comhghleacaithe, cairde, comharsana agus daoine eile sa phobal.
en: Vaccination protects the vaccinated persons and those around them who are vulnerable to the diseases, reducing the risk of diseases spreading among family members, school mates or colleagues, friends, neighbours and other people in the community.

ga: Nuair a bhíonn go leor daoine ann i ndaonra atá imdhíonach ar ghalar tógálach, ní dócha go scaipfidh an galar ansin ó dhuine go duine.
en: When enough people in a population are immune to an infectious disease, the disease is then unlikely to spread from person to person.

ga: Community immunity
en: Community immunity

ga: Tarlaíonn imdhíonacht phobail nuair a bhíonn go leor daoine ann i ndaonra atá imdhíonach ar ghalar tógálach
en: Community immunity occurs when enough people in a population are immune to an infectious disease

ga: Ar an mbealach sin, cosnaíonn vacsaíní daoine eile atá i mbaol galair go hindíreach.
en: In this way, vaccines indirectly protect others who are vulnerable to disease.

ga: Ciallaíonn sé go mbaineann daoine nach féidir iad a vacsaíniú, mar shampla toisc go bhfuil siad ró-óg nó toisc go bhfuil ailléirge orthu le comhpháirteanna vacsaíne, leas ó dhaoine eile a bheith vacsaínithe, de bharr nach féidir leis an ngalar leathadh go héasca sa phobal.
en: It means that people who cannot be vaccinated, for instance because they are too young or allergic to vaccine components, benefit from others being vaccinated, because the disease cannot easily spread in the community.

ga: Mar shampla, chun imdhíonacht phobail ar bhruitíní a áirithiú, molann na húdaráis um shláinte phoiblí go bhfaigheann 95% den daonra vacsaín le dhá dháileog den vacsaín in aghaidh na bruitíní (an vacsaín MMR, a chosnaíonn in aghaidh na bruitíní, leicneach agus rubella).
en: For example, to ensure community immunity against measles, public health authorities recommend that 95% of the population are vaccinated with two doses of the vaccine against measles (the MMR vaccine, which protects against measles, mumps and rubella).

ga: Mar sin féin, ní féidir le daoine a bheith brath ar imdhíonacht phobail i gcás roinnt galar tógálach.
en: However, people cannot rely on community immunity for some infectious diseases.

ga: Ina theannta sin, cabhraíonn cláir imdhíonta le hualaí sóisialta, síceolaíocha agus airgeadais an ghalair ar dhaoine agus ar rialtais a laghdú, ag laghdú brúnna ar chórais chúraim sláinte agus chúraim shóisialta agus ag cur ar chumas daoine dul i mbun gníomhaíochtaí táirgiúla lena n-áirítear oideachas agus fostaíocht.
en: Furthermore, immunisation programmes help reduce the social, psychological and financial burdens of disease on people and governments, reducing pressures on healthcare and social care systems and enabling people to pursue productive activities including education and employment.

ga: Cosnaíonn an vacsaíniú daoine aonair ar ghalair a d’fhéadfadh iarmhairtí tromchúiseacha a bheith acu ar shláinte an duine, mar shampla:
en: Vaccination protects individuals against diseases that could have serious consequences for their health, for example:

ga: maraíonn an diftéire duine as gach deichniúir a tholgann í, fiú nuair a chuirtear cóir leighis orthu (1);
en: diphtheria kills 1 in every 10 people who get it, even with treatment (1);

ga: beidh an siondróm rubella ó bhroinn (siondróm lena ngabhann fadhbanna sláinte amhail bodhaire, catarachtaí agus míchumais fhoghlama) ar bheagnach naonúr leanbh as gach deichniúr a raibh rubella ar a máithreacha le linn an luathtoirchis (2);
en: almost 9 out of 10 babies born to mothers who had rubella in early pregnancy, will suffer from congenital rubella syndrome (with conditions such as deafness, cataracts and learning disabilities) (2);

ga: maraíonn an galar meiningeacocúil duine as gach deichniúr a bhuailtear leis, fiú agus meardiagnóis agus cóir leighis a bheith ann, agus bíonn fadhbanna ann ar nós néarlagú nó lagú éisteachta agus teascadh i gcás suas le 20% dóibh siúd a thagann slán ón ngalar (3);
en: meningococcal disease kills 1 in 10 people affected, even with prompt diagnosis and treatment, while problems including neurological or hearing impairment and amputation occur in up to 20% of survivors (3);

ga: tá an bhruitíneach an-tógálach ar fad agus bíonn aimhréidheanna ag triúir as gach deichniúr a bhuailtear léi (4), orthu siúd áirítear ionfhabhtuithe cluaise, an bhuinneach, niúmóine agus einceifealaíteas (athlasadh fhíocháin na hinchinne);
en: measles is highly contagious and 3 out of 10 people affected develop complications (4), which can include ear infection, diarrhoea, pneumonia and encephalitis (inflammation of the brain tissue);

ga: is féidir go mbeidh pertussis (an triuch) thar a bheith tromchúiseach i naíonáin, agus é ina údar le ráigeanna casachta ar féidir leo teacht ar ais go ceann suas le dhá mhí.
en: pertussis (whooping cough) can be particularly serious in infants, causing coughing spells that may recur for up to two months.

ga: Ar an liosta seo le samplaí tá galair a bhfuil vacsaíní ina aghaidh mar chuid de na cláir náisiúnta um imdhíonadh, agus/nó ar vacsaíní iad a thugtar do dhaoine a mheastar gur mó an baol go dtolgóidh siad an galar.
en: This list with examples includes diseases for which vaccines are included in the national immunisation programmes, and/or are given to persons considered to be at a higher risk of getting the disease.

ga: Cosnaíonn vacsaíní daoine le linn tráthanna éagsúla den saol.
en: Vaccines protect people during different stages of life.

ga: I sceidil náisiúnta vacsaínithe AE/LEE, moltar vacsaíní ag aoiseanna ar leith agus do phobail ar leith.
en: National vaccination schedules in EU/EEA countries recommend vaccines at specific ages and for specific populations.

ga: Tá ról ag gairmithe cúraim sláinte
en: Healthcare professionals

ga: Níl roinnt vacsaíní mar chuid de na gnáthsceidil vacsaínithe, ach dírítear iad ar ghrúpaí ar leith.
en: Some vaccines are not part of routine vaccination schedules but are targeted at specific groups.

ga: Bíonn gach tír AE/LEE freagrach as a mbeartas sláinte phoiblí náisiúnta féin, lena n-áirítear a gclár imdhíonta náisiúnta agus a sceideal vacsaínithe. Is féidir teacht ar na sceidil vacsaínithe náisiúnta sna tíortha AE/LEE i Sceidealóir Vacsaíní ECDC
en: Each EU/EEA country is responsible for its own national public health policy, including its national immunisation programme and vaccination schedule. Information on the national vaccination schedules in EU/EEA countries can be found in the ECDC Vaccine Scheduler

ga: Tá roinnt éagsúlachtaí ann sa chaoi ina n-eagraíonn tíortha a sceidil vacsaínithe, ar comhchosúil seachas comhionann iad sna tíortha AE/LEE éagsúla.
en: There are some differences in the way countries organise their vaccination schedules, which are similar but not identical in different EU/EEA countries.

ga: D’fhéadfaí a áireamh leis na fachtóirí taobh thiar de na héagsúlachtaí le hualach an ghalair, leitheadúlacht an ghalair agus treochtaí sna tíortha éagsúla, acmhainní agus struchtúir na gcóras cúraim shláinte, fachtóirí polaitiúla agus cultúrtha, chomh maith le hathléimneacht an chláir vacsaínithe.
en: Factors driving such differences may include the disease's burden, prevalence of the disease and trends in different countries, the resources and structures of healthcare systems, political and cultural factors, as well as the resilience of the vaccination programme.

ga: Ná tuigtear ó na héagsúlachtaí idir na sceidil vacsaínithe gur fearr roinnt acu thar a chéile.
en: The differences between vaccination schedules do not mean that some are better than others.

ga: Áirítear leis na sceidil vacsaínithe leanbhaoise i ngach aon tír AE/LEE an vacsaíniú in aghaidh:
en: The childhood vaccination schedules in all EU/EEA countries include the vaccination against:

ga: na bruitíní
en: measles

ga: na leicní
en: mumps

ga: rubella
en: rubella

ga: na diftéire
en: diphtheria

ga: teiteanais
en: tetanus

ga: an treacha
en: pertussis (whooping cough)

ga: polaimiailítis
en: poliomyelitis

ga: Haemophilus influenzae cineál B
en: Haemophilus influenzae type B

ga: papalómaivíris dhaonna (cailíní ógánacha/réamh-ógánacha).
en: human papillomavirus (adolescent/pre-adolescent girls).

ga: Molann an Eagraíocht Dhomhanda Sláinte (EDS) an vacsaíniú i gcoinne heipitítis B mar chuid den sceideal uilíoch vacsaínithe leanbhaoise, ach ní dhéanann ach roinnt tíortha AE/LEE vacsaíniú ar leanaí le hardriosca ionfhabhtaithe, agus ar aosaigh in eochairghrúpaí riosca.
en: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends vaccination against hepatitis B as part of the universal childhood vaccination schedule, but some EU/EEA countries only vaccinate children at high risk of infection and adults in key risk groups.

ga: Tairgtear cosaint do leanaí i roinnt tíortha AE/LEE tríd an vacsaíniú i gcoinne:
en: Children in some EU/EEA countries are offered protection through vaccination against:

ga: heipitítis A
en: hepatitis A

ga: fliú
en: influenza

ga: galair ionraigh de bharr Neisseria meningitidis
en: invasive disease caused by Neisseria meningitidis

ga: galair ionraigh de bharr Streptococcus pneumoniae
en: invasive disease caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae

ga: rótaivíris
en: rotavirus

ga: eitinne
en: tuberculosis

ga: varicella
en: varicella

ga: Ina theannta sin is amhlaidh a bhíonn moltaí ag gach tír AE/LEE le haghaidh an fhliú shéasúraigh i measc daoine scothaosta agus eochairghrúpaí riosca.
en: In addition, all EU/EEA countries have recommendations for seasonal influenza (flu) for older people and key risk groups.

ga: Tá AE ag fiosrú faoi chomhchuibhiú breise na sceideal vacsaínithe náisiúnta. D’eisigh an Chomhairle AE Moltaí an 7 Nollaig 2018 (EN)
en: The EU is exploring further harmonisation of national vaccination schedules. The EU Council issued Recommendations on 7 December 2018

ga: maidir le comhar neartaithe i gcoinne galar atá inchoiscthe le vacsaíní, lena n-áirítear scrúdú a dhéanamh ar fhéidearthacht de chroí-sceideal vacsaínithe AE.
en: on strengthened cooperation against vaccine-preventable diseases, which include examining the feasibility of a core EU vaccination schedule.

ga: Ba é an aidhm leis comhoiriúnacht na sceideal vacsaínithe náisiúnta a fheabhsú agus rochtain chomhionann ar vacsaínithe ar fud AE a chur chun cinn.
en: The aim would be to improve the compatibility of national vaccination schedules and promote equal access to vaccinations across the EU.

ga: Cuireann gach tír AE/LEE a clár imdhíonta féin chun feidhme.
en: Each EU/EEA country implements its own immunisation programme.

ga: Tá ardrátaí cumhdaithe vacsaínithe bainte amach ag tíortha AE/LEE trí vacsaíniú éigeantach agus neamh-éigeantach.
en: EU/EEA countries have achieved high vaccination coverage rates through mandatory and non-mandatory vaccination.

ga: Cinneann gach tír AE/LEE an bhfuil an vacsaíniú éigeantach nó deonach ina críoch féin.
en: Each EU/EEA country decides if vaccination is mandatory or voluntary in its territory.

ga: Tá eolas maidir leis na tíortha a bhfuil vacsaíniú éigeantach ag baint leo le fáil sa Sceidealóir Vacsaíne.
en: Information on which countries have mandatory vaccination can be found in the Vaccine Scheduler.

ga: D’fhéadfadh sé nach bhfuair roinnt daoine vacsaíniú nó nach bhfuair an líon molta dáileoga.
en: Some people may have missed a vaccination or did not get the recommended number of doses.

ga: Ba cheart do gach duine seiceáil go bhfuair siad na vacsaíní atá molta go náisiúnta, agus comhairle a lorg ó ghairmí leighis i gcás go bhfuil cinn chúitimh de dhíth.
en: Everyone should check if they have had the nationally recommended vaccinations, and consult a medical professional in case any catch-ups are needed.

ga: Mura bhfuil a fhios ag duine cé acu an bhfuair sé vacsaíniú in aghaidh galar ar leith nó nach bhfuair, is féidir leis dáileog sa bhreis a fháil gan an baol ar aon fho-iarmhairtí tromchúiseacha a mhéadú (1).
en: If a person does not know if they have been vaccinated against a certain disease they can usually get an extra dose without increasing the risk of serious side effects (1).

ga: measles vaccine
en: measles vaccine

ga: © iStock
en: © iStock

ga: Is féidir cláir vacsaínithe cúitimh a eagrú do ghalair áirithe.
en: Catch-up vaccination programmes for specific diseases may be organised.

ga: Tugann an chuid is mó de vacsaíní imdhíonacht ar feadh an tsaoil.
en: Most vaccines provide lifelong immunity.

ga: Tugann cuid vacsaíní, áfach, imdhíonacht a mhaolaíonn le himeacht ama, ar a dtugtar ‘imdhíonacht mhaolaitheach’. I roinnt tíortha moltar teanndáileoga ag eatraimh rialta le linn ógántachta agus aosachta, chun imdhíonacht a choimeád ar feadh tréimhse níos faide, in aghaidh, mar shampla:
en: However, some vaccines provide immunity that decreases over time, known as ‘waning immunity’. Some countries recommend booster doses at regular intervals during adolescence and adulthood, in order to maintain immunity over a longer period of time, against for example:

ga: diftéire
en: diphtheria

ga: teiteanas
en: tetanus

ga: pertussis (triuch)
en: pertussis (whooping cough)

ga: I roinnt tíortha moltar teanndáileoga go sonrach do dhaoine a bhíonn ag taisteal nó dóibh siúd atá i mbaol méadaithe ar nochtadh don ghalar.
en: Some countries recommend boosters specifically for individuals travelling or at increased risk of being exposed to the disease.

ga: Tabharfaidh soláthraí cúraim sláinte faisnéis faoi na teanndáileoga atá de dhíth.
en: Healthcare providers can provide information on the booster doses needed.

ga: D'fhéadfaí vacsaín a bheith fritásctha do dhaoine áirithe, rud a chiallaíonn nach ceart dóibh é a fháil.
en: A vaccine may be contraindicated for certain people, meaning they should not receive it.

ga: Tá vacsaín fritásctha dóibh siúd a bhfuil ailléirge orthu le haon cheann de substaintí gníomhacha nó de chomhábhair ghníomhacha na vacsaíne mar atá liostaithe san fhaisnéis faoin táirge.
en: A vaccine is contraindicated to those allergic to any of the vaccine active substances or ingredients as listed in the product information.

ga: Tá stair 'anaifiolachtach' nó frithghníomh ailléirgeach tromchúiseach eile tar éis vacsaín a fháil ina fritásc le dáileoga breise den vacsaín sin a fháil.
en: A history of 'anaphylactic' or other serious allergic reaction after receiving a vaccine is a contraindication to further doses of that vaccine.

ga: Tá neamhoird córas imdhíonachta áirithe (e.
en: Certain immune system disorders (e.

ga: I gcásanna áirithe, moltar cur i gcrích na n-imdhíontaí a theastaíonn roimh thús na cóireála, mar le linn na cóireála d'fhéadfadh rioscaí níos airde ionfhabhtaithe a bheith ar an othar.
en: In some cases, the completion of the immunisations needed is recommended prior to the start of a treatment, as during the treatment the patient may be at higher risks of infection.

ga: Tá roinnt vacsaíní fritásctha le linn toirchis, amhail an bhruitíneach, an leicneach agus an bhruitíneach dhearg.
en: Some vaccines are contraindicated during pregnancy, such as measles, mumps and rubella.

ga: D’fhéadfadh fritásca eile a bheith ann maidir le vacsaíní sonracha, ar gá iad a phlé leis an soláthraí cúraim sláinte.
en: There may be other contraindications for specific vaccines, which need discussing with the healthcare provider.

ga: Úsáidtear vacsaíní ar fud an domhain mar bhealach an-éifeachtach le daoine a chosaint ar tholgadh galar tógálach.
en: Vaccines are used worldwide as a highly effective way to protect people from contracting infectious diseases.

ga: Forbraíodh an chéad vacsaín san 18ú aois sa Ríocht Aontaithe.
en: The first vaccine was developed in the 18th century in the United Kingdom.

ga: Tá a lán vacsaíní ann in aghaidh a lán galar sa lá atá inniu ann.
en: Nowadays, there are vaccines for many diseases.

ga: Tá an físeán seo ar fáil in 24 teanga AE.
en: This video is available in 24 EU languages.

ga: Sábháilteacht, cáilíocht agus caighdeáin
en: Safety, quality and standards

ga: Sula bhféadfadh aon vacsaín nua a úsáid, ní foláir diantástáil a dhéanamh air.
en: Before any new vaccine can be used, it has to undergo rigorous testing.

ga: Ní foláir léiriú sa mheasúnú go bhfuil na buntáistí maidir le cosaint daoine ar ghalair i bhfad níos mó ná aon riosca féideartha.
en: This evaluation needs to show that a vaccine’s benefits in protecting people against diseases are far greater than any potential risk.

ga: Is ansin amháin, tar éis ceadú, is féidir vacsaín a tháirgeadh, a chur ar an margadh agus a úsáid le daoine a chosaint.
en: Only then, after approval, can a vaccine be manufactured, marketed and used to protect people.

ga: Mar a bhíonn le gach aon leigheas, d’fhéadfadh go mbeadh fo-iarmhairtí ar roinnt daoine, ach bíonn siad sin éadrom agus ní mhaireann i bhfad.
en: As with any medicine, some people may experience side effects from a vaccine, but these are usually mild and short-lived.

ga: Buntáistí vacsaínithe
en: Benefits of vaccinating

ga: Cuireann vacsaíní cosc ar ghalair a d'fhéadfadh a bheith ina gcúis le fadhbanna sláinte tromchúiseacha, míchumas buan nó fiú bás.
en: Vaccines prevent diseases that could otherwise cause serious health problems, permanent disability or even death.

ga: Mar shampla, i rith 2018 fuair thart ar 86% de naíonáin ar fud an domhain trí dháileog den vacsaín a chosnaíonn iad i gcoinne diftéire, teiteanais agus treacha (DTP), agus fuair 85% de naíonáin ar fud an domhain trí dháileog den vacsaín polaimiailítis (1).
en: For example, during 2018 about 86% of infants worldwide received three doses of the vaccine that protects them against diphtheria, tetanus and pertussis (DTP), and 85% of infants around the world received three doses of polio vaccine (1).

ga: Murab ionann agus cóireáil a thugtar chun tinneas a leigheas, is iondúil go dtugtar vacsaíní do dhaoine sláintiúla chun iad a cosc ar thinneas.
en: Unlike a treatment given to cure an illness, vaccines are usually given to healthy people to prevent them from getting ill.

ga: Tá go leor galar tógálach an-annamh sa lá atá inniu ann a bhuí le vacsaíniú.
en: Many infectious diseases are very rare today thanks to vaccination, so the negative consequences of these diseases are sometimes forgotten.

ga: Mar shampla: an bhruitíneach
en: Example: measles

ga: Ba bheag gur díbríodh an bhruitíneach i mórán tíortha Eorpacha.
en: Measles had almost been eliminated in many European countries.

ga: Mar sin féin, ó mhí Dheireadh Fómhair 2016, tá an bhruitíneach á nochtadh féin athuair san AE/LEE, le ráigeanna i roinnt tíortha (2), mar gheall ar laghdú ar rátaí vacsaínithe.
en: However, since October 2016 a resurgence of measles has been observed in the EU/EEA, with outbreaks in several countries (2), due to a decline in vaccination rates.

ga: D'fhéadfadh an bhruitíneach a bheith tromchúiseach nó fiú bagrach don bheatha.
en: Measles can be serious or even life-threatening.

ga: Is é an vacsaíniú an t-aon chosaint in aghaidh na bruitíní.
en: The only protection against measles is vaccination.

ga: Mar shampla: an triuch
en: Example: pertussis

ga: Is galar é an triuch a chuireann isteach ar na haerchonairí.
en: Pertussis (whooping cough) is a disease affecting the airways.

ga: Ar na aimhréidheanna a bhaineann leis d’fhéadfadh niúmóine, einceifileapaite (galar inchinne), taomanna agus fiú bás tarlú dá dheasca.
en: Complications can include pneumonia, encephalopathy (a disease of the brain), seizures and even death.

ga: Tá vacsaíniú in aghaidh an treacha mar chuid de na cláir náisiúnta imdhíonta san AE.
en: Vaccination against pertussis is part of national immunisation programmes in the EU.

ga: Formheas vacsaíní san Aontas Eorpach
en: Approval of vaccines in the European Union

ga: Sular féidir vacsaín a fhormheas san Aontas Eorpach, ní mór d’fhorbróir na vacsaíne í a chur faoi dhiantástáil agus, ina dhiaidh sin, ní mór d’údaráis rialála measúnú eolaíochta a dhéanamh uirthi.
en: Before a vaccine can be approved in the EU, it has to undergo rigorous testing by its developer and then scientific evaluation by regulatory authorities.

ga: Folaíonn tástáil cáilíocht na vacsaíne a sheiceáil:
en: Testing includes checking the vaccine’s quality:

ga: a híonacht;
en: its purity;

ga: a comhábhair, lena n-áirítear a comhábhair neamhghníomhacha nó a cuid ‘támháin’;
en: its ingredients, including its inactive ingredients or ‘excipients’;

ga: conas a mhonaraítear í.
en: how it is manufactured.

ga: Déanann forbróir na vacsaíne éifeachtaí na vacsaíne a thástáil ansin.
en: Then the vaccine developer tests the vaccine’s effects.

ga: Ina dhiaidh sin bíonn clár tástála cliniciúla ann i measc daoine.
en: This is followed by a clinical testing programme in humans.

ga: D’fhéadfadh sé go nglacfadh sé sin thart ar dheich mbliana ó thráth an choincheapa tosaigh go dtí céim an fhormheasa.
en: This can take around ten years from initial concept to authorisation.

ga: 20 - 100 oibrí deonach sláintiúil
en: 20 - 100 healthy volunteers

ga: Céard a sheiceáiltear:
en: What is checked:

ga: An bhfuil an chuma air go bhfuil an vacsaín ag obair?
en: Does the vaccine seem to work?

ga: An bhfuil fo-iarmhairtí tromchúiseacha ann?
en: Are there serious side effects?

ga: An bhfuil an vacsaín sábháilte?
en: Is the vaccine safe?

ga: Ag deireadh an chláir tástála, cuireann forbróir na vacsaíne na torthaí faoi bhráid na n-údarás rialála leigheasra san Eoraip mar chuid d‘iarratas ar’ údarú margaíochta’ .
en: At the end of the testing programme, the vaccine developer submits the results to the medicines regulatory authorities in Europe as part of a ‘marketing authorisation’ application.

ga: Ní féidir leis na rialtóirí an vacsaín a fhormheas ach amháin i gcás ina dtaispeánann measúnú eolaíochta thorthaí na dtástálacha gurb amhlaidh gur mó tairbhí na vacsaíne ná na rioscaí a bhaineann léi.
en: The regulators can only approve the vaccine if its scientific evaluation of the tests results show that the vaccine’s benefits are greater than its risks.

ga: Is féidir le húdaráis rialála cigireachtaí a dhéanamh chun a chinntiú go bhfuil an fhaisnéis a thugann forbróir na vacsaíne iontaofa.
en: Medicines regulatory authorities can carry out inspections to make sure that the information the vaccine developer provides is trustworthy.

ga: Faireachán a dhéanamh ar sábháilteacht vacsaíne agus fo-iarmhairtí a thuairisciú
en: Monitoring vaccine safety and reporting side effects

ga: Nuair a cheadaítear vacsaín le húsáid, déanann údaráis náisiúnta an AE/LEE agus an Ghníomhaireacht Leigheasra Eorpach
en: Once a vaccine is approved for use, EU/EEA national authorities and the European Medicines Agency

ga: (EMA), faireachán leanúnach ar fho-iarmhairtí ar dhaoine a fuair an vacsaín.
en: (EMA), continually monitor side effects in people who have received the vaccine.

ga: Cinntíonn sé sin go mbraitear agus bainistítear aon rioscaí féideartha chomh luath agus is féidir.
en: This ensures that any possible risks are detected and managed as soon as possible.

ga: Déanann EMA faisnéis nua a sheiceáil faoi shábháilteacht gach vacsaín san Eoraip. Déanann sí anailís ar chuid mhór foinsí sonraí, lena n-áirítear:
en: EMA checks new information on the safety of all vaccines available in Europe. It analyses many sources of data, including:

ga: tuarascálacha ó othair, tuismitheoirí agus gairmí cúraim sláinte;
en: reports from patients, parents and healthcare professionals;

ga: staidéir chliniciúla;
en: clinical studies;

ga: an litríocht leighis;
en: the medical literature;

ga: faisnéis a thugann rialtóirí eile.
en: information shared by other regulators.

ga: Measann EMA fo-iarmhairtí amhrasta go cúramach le fáil amach cé acu an bhfuil baint fhánach leis an víreas nó nach bhfuil.
en: EMA carefully assesses suspected side effects to determine if there is a causal link with the vaccine or not.

ga: Tá an físeán seo ar fáil in 24 teanga AE.
en: This video is available in 24 EU languages.

ga: Gníomhaíonn EMA agus rialtóirí Eorpacha eile nuair is gá.
en: When needed, EMA and the other European regulators take action.

ga: Ba cheart d’othair, gairmí cúraim sláinte agus cuideachtaí cógaisíochta gach fo-iarmhairtí amhrasta a thuairisciú dá n-údarás náisiúnta rialála cógas leighis.
en: Patients, healthcare professionals and pharmaceutical companies should report all suspected side effects to their national medicines regulatory authority.

ga: Tá tuilleadh faisnéise ar na fo-iarmhairtí amhrasta a tuairiscíodh ar fáil don phobal ar Bunachar sonraí Eorpach na dtuarascálacha um fhrithghníomh díobhálach amhrasta in aghaidh druga.
en: Information on these reported suspected side effects is publicly available on the European database of suspected adverse drug reaction reports.

ga: Tugtar ‘faireachas cógas’ ar an bpróiseas faireacháin ar shábháilteacht cógas agus na rioscaí a bhainistiú.
en: The process of monitoring the safety and managing the risks of medicines is called ‘pharmacovigilance’.

ga: Éifeachtacht vacsaíne
en: Vaccine effectiveness

ga: Is é an cumas atá ag vacsaíne le galar ar leith a chosc a rialaíonn a héifeachtacht.
en: A vaccine's ability to prevent a specific disease determines its effectiveness.

ga: Mar a bhíonn le haon leigheas, níl aon vacsaín 100% éifeachtach i ngach duine atá vacsaínithe.
en: As with any medicine, no vaccine is 100% effective in every person vaccinated.

ga: Áirítear leo sin:
en: These include:
